body_html: @apaszke Matrix multiplications (spaddmm and sspaddmm) use it. For CPU version, the parts that use CSR information are here (spaddmm) and here (sspaddmm). For GPU version, it calls THCudaSparse_<t>csrmm2 from cuSPARSE, as in here. This pull request does not modify these parts, but caches CSR representations they use. Incidentally, these are the parts that require indices of coalesced sparse matrices to be sorted. (reason for Bug #6219)
body_text: @apaszke Matrix multiplications (spaddmm and sspaddmm) use it. For CPU version, the parts that use CSR information are here (spaddmm) and here (sspaddmm). For GPU version, it calls THCudaSparse_<t>csrmm2 from cuSPARSE, as in here. This pull request does not modify these parts, but caches CSR representations they use. Incidentally, these are the parts that require indices of coalesced sparse matrices to be sorted. (reason for Bug #6219)
body: @apaszke Matrix multiplications (`spaddmm` and `sspaddmm`) use it. For CPU version, the parts that use CSR information are [here](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/pull/6225/commits/473d4cbb24ac3ad8b69c9a61b0a752e1b39447f4#diff-2ed4289bac982ea74e5a214ae77e373dR354) (`spaddmm`) and [here](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/pull/6225/commits/473d4cbb24ac3ad8b69c9a61b0a752e1b39447f4#diff-2ed4289bac982ea74e5a214ae77e373dL433) (`sspaddmm`). For GPU version, it calls `THCudaSparse_<t>csrmm2` from cuSPARSE, as in [here](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/pull/6225/commits/473d4cbb24ac3ad8b69c9a61b0a752e1b39447f4#diff-86d86cb1abb1b54618acb95de562ae7fR134). This pull request does not modify these parts, but caches CSR representations they use. Incidentally, these are the parts that require indices of coalesced sparse matrices to be sorted. (reason for Bug #6219)
